00033 
00034 #ifndef PAR_PARTITION_H
00035 #define PAR_PARTITION_H
00036 ///
00037 /// @file par_partition.h
00038 /// @brief Distributed representation of a partitioning of a data set.
00039 ///
00040 
00041 #include <mpi.h>
00042 #include <vector>
00043 #include <ostream>
00044 
00045 #include "partition.h"
00046 
00047 
00048 namespace cluster {
00049   
00050   ///
00051   /// par_partition represents a partitioning of a distributed data set.
00052   /// It is analogous to partition, but its object_ids are distributed across
00053   /// the ranks of the communicator it is instantiated with.  Each process is assumed
00054   /// to "own" some set of objects in the data set this describes, and each process's
00055   /// par_partition object contains medoid_ids only for its own objects. Thus, the cluster_ids
00056   /// array will contain different object_ids on different processes within the "same"
00057   /// par_partition object.
00058   /// 
00059   /// While cluster_ids will vary, the "same" par_partition object on the same 
00060   /// communicator will have the same medoid_ids.  If this is not true, then the medoid_ids
00061   /// won't make any sense between processes.  Partitioning algorithms that use a 
00062   /// par_partition for output should preserve this property.
00063   /// 
00064   /// You can convert a par_partition to a partition on a single process using 
00065   /// the gather() method.  This is a collective operation.  It is not scalable, in that 
00066   /// it will aggregate ids from <i>every</i> process in the communicator to <i>one</i> process.
00067   /// However, it's useful for small systems and debugging.
00068   /// 
00069   /// @see partition, the non-distributed equivalent of this class.
00070   ///
00071   struct par_partition {
00072     /// Gives the object id for the ith medoid.  This object may not be local.
00073     std::vector<object_id> medoid_ids;
00074     
00075     /// Global cluster ids for local objects.  These are indices into medoid_ids.
00076     /// The object id of the medoid of the ith local object is medoid_ids[cluster_ids[i]].
00077     std::vector<object_id> cluster_ids;
00078     
00079     /// Communicator, the processes of which this partition divides
00080     MPI_Comm comm;
00081 
00082     /// Construct a parallel partition for the communicator supplied
00083     /// Partition starts off with everyone in one cluster with medoid 0.
00084     par_partition(MPI_Comm comm = MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00085 
00086     /// Virtual destructor for inheritance.
00087     virtual ~par_partition();
00088 
00089     /// Scalably get the sizes of all the clusters in this partition.
00090     /// POST: sizes is valid on all processes
00091     void get_sizes(std::vector<size_t>& sizes);
00092 
00093     /// Collective operation.  Gathers my_id from all processes into a 
00094     /// local partition object. If size of system is large, then this method
00095     /// will not scale.
00096     void gather(partition& local, int root=0);
00097   };
00098 
00099   ///
00100   /// Right now this just uses parition::operator<<() by making a 
00101   /// partition with this par_partition's cluster_ids and medoid_ids vectors
00102   /// and outputting it.
00103   /// 
00104   /// @todo fix the implementation; it's a little hacky.  
00105   ///
00106   std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& out, const par_partition& par);
00107 
00108 } // namespace cluster
00109 
00110 #endif // PAR_PARTITION_H
00111
